item.description: Melissa Guimont will train volunteers to monitor the native bird nesting boxes in MSSF. Meet at the MSSF Headquarters Parking Lot at the "Interpretive Center" to carpool to the fields at 10.00. Please bring a notepad and pen, binoculars and a phillips head screwdriver. The training will last ~ 2 hours. If there is rain, we will reschedule it for Saturday May 7th at 10:00. We will send an email out to all those who sign up for rescheduling if the weather doesn't cooperate. We will be looking in the birdboxes and setting up a schedule for volunteers to check these boxes once a week from May-August.  Please attend if you have a birdbox in your yard that you need to monitor also!
item.why: It would help the Native Bird Support Group's efforts to increase the natiive species in the forest.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Monitor bird boxes for successful bluebird populations
